children.value: Please RSVP by December 14th so that we may have an accurate headcount. :)
Your plus one(s) should have been invited as well! They should have received an invitation as well.
As much as we love your little ones, we will not be including them in the ceremony or reception.

properties.title: What will the weather be like?

children.value: Welcome to the bay area, all of you out-of-towners! Every season is beautiful here; however, during February, it will be COLD! Typically, the weather floats around from 66Â°F during the daytime.
There is plenty of free parking near the venue! There is also the Nassau Av subway station a 6 minute walk away (0.3 miles).

properties.title: Are the ceremony and reception locations wheelchair accessible?

children.value: Our dress code is formal attire! For men, this means a suit jacket over a button up shirt! For ladies, this means a nice dress. Please don't wear your heels on the subway - bring extra shoes if needed! It is totally normal for people to change from boots to heels here in NYC.

properties.title: Is the wedding indoors or outdoors?

children.value: Our wedding ceremony and reception are indoors, but our cocktail hour will be outdoors.

properties.title: Is it okay to take pictures with our phones and cameras during the wedding?

children.value: Yes! We would love for you to take photos and share them

We recommend flying into John F. Kennedy International Airport or LaGuardia Airport. From JFK, you can take the Air Train ($8.00 one way) and connect to the New York City Subway (MTA). From LGA, we recommend Ubering to your lodgings; however, depending on where you are staying, it may be more cost and time efficient to fly into LGA.
Rule of Thirds 171 Banker St Brooklyn, NY 347-334-6684

Rule of Thirds is about a 6 minute walk (0.3 miles) from the Nassau Av subway station on the G line (green line). There is also plenty of street parking near the venue if you decide to drive to the destination. Alternatively, there are a few parking lots around as well.
